com.harrison.assignment.Screen

Class GameScreen.ChoiceListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.harrison.assignment.Screen.GameScreen.ChoiceListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener
    Enclosing class:
    GameScreen

    private class GameScreen.ChoiceListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Any mouse events regarding the choice labels is handled here

      • play

        private void play(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
        Starts the game cycle, this will update GUI components. Uses Game to play the game.
        Parameters:
        event - indicates which label was clicked, must be passed from mouseClicked(MouseEvent)

      • playRound

        private void playRound(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event,
             int timeMillis)
        Plays one round of the game. Starts the Game logic off, updates this clicked JLabel to have a green border to indicate its been clicked.
        Parameters:
        event - indicates which label was clicked, must be passed from mouseClicked(MouseEvent)

      • endGame

        private void endGame()
        Displays the outcome of the game to the player. After the final round of Game displays the outcome to the player using a FinishDialog, if enabled it will also play a sound. Will dispose this GameScreen

      • timedUpdate

        private void timedUpdate(int timeMillis)
        Updates any JLabel that are in the stats JPanel. Uses a Timer to do this so keep in mind any threading issues with other Timer used in the code.
        Parameters:
        timeMillis - indicates the time in milliseconds that you want the timer to go through before it calls the method

      • timedRoundEnd

        private void timedRoundEnd(int timeMillis)
        Resets the screen after a given amount of milliseconds. Uses a Timer to do this so keep in mind any threading issues with other Timer used in the code.
        Parameters:
        timeMillis - indicates the time in milliseconds that you want the timer to go through before it calls the method

      • timedDispose

        private void timedDispose(int timeMillis)
        Disposes of this screen after a given amount of milliseconds. Uses a Timer to do this so keep in mind any threading issues with other Timer used in the code.
        Parameters:
        timeMillis - indicates the time in milliseconds that you want the timer to go through before it calls the method

      • playFinishSound

        private void playFinishSound()
        Plays the respective sound for the outcome of the game. Uses Sound to play one of the possible sounds to indicate to the player their outcome.

      • playChoiceSound

        private void playChoiceSound()
        Plays the "Rock, Paper, Scissors" sound. Uses Sound to play the choice sound whenever the player picks one of the possible options.
